alert.note: Alert for Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:17PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Newton and southwestern Boone Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 217 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harrison, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrison... Western Grove... Valley Springs... Dugger... Capps... Bellefonte... Batavia... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations
